measured_by: gamified risky decision making task (The Great Brain Experiment)
justification: "We measured propensity to take different types of risks … in a sample of 2,599 participants who played a gamified risky decision making task on a smartphone platform (The Great Brain Experiment)."

measured_by: proportion of risky choices in gain trials of the smartphone task
justification: "Gain trials … had potential gains and no potential losses … on any trial participants could opt for a risky choice," so the number of risky choices in these gain trials indexes risk taking for gains.

measured_by: proportion of risky choices in loss trials of the smartphone task
justification: "Loss trials … had potential losses and no potential gains" and the study correlates "the number of risky choices in loss trials" with other variables to quantify loss-related risk taking.

measured_by: proportion of risky choices in mixed trials of the smartphone task
justification: Mixed trials "featured risky options with equal probabilities of potential gains and losses," so choosing the risky option in these trials serves as the measure of mixed-frame risk taking.

measured_by: α_loss parameter from prospect theory model
justification: "…a separate power function for the gain and loss values (loss sensitivity: αloss…)" indicates that the α_loss parameter operationalises loss sensitivity in the model.

measured_by: α_gain parameter from prospect theory model
justification: The same passage defines "gain sensitivity: αgain," showing that α_gain is the metric for gain sensitivity.

measured_by: λ (log λ) parameter from prospect theory model
justification: The model includes "a multiplier for any loss values (loss aversion: λ)," making λ the quantitative measure of loss aversion.

measured_by: inverse temperature parameter µ from prospect theory model
justification: "The softmax includes an inverse temperature parameter (µ) which quantifies choice stochasticity," directly linking µ to the construct of choice randomness.
